channel.title: Cointelegraph.com News
channel.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

image.title: Cointelegraph.com News
image.description: Cointelegraph covers fintech, blockchain and Bitcoin bringing you the latest news and analyses on the future of money.

item.title: Judge pulls out of SBF-FTX case citing husband's law firm's advisory link
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Arijit Sarkar
item.description: Judge Abrams’ withdrawal from the FTX case eradicates any conflict of interest in the FTX case because Andres continues to serve as a partner at Davis Polk & Wardwell, a law firm that advised FTX in 2021.

item.title: Santas and Grinches: The heroes and villains of 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shiraz Jagati
item.description: Here’s a list of the 12 individuals who had the most impact — for better or worse — on the crypto industry this past year.

item.title: Economic frailty could soon give Bitcoin a new role in global trade
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Joseph Bradley
item.description: Aggressive interest rate hikes have wrought havoc on global markets. As a consequence, more countries may embrace Bitcoin in the year ahead.

item.title: U.S. delays crypto tax reporting rules, as it still can’t define what a 'broker' is
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Congress passed a law in November 2021 that required the new crypto rules to be issued.

item.title: 2 executives of crypto exchange AAX arrested in Hong Kong: Report
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: The former CEO of AAX, Liang Haoming, and the founder of AAX, Thor Chan, were arrested on Dec. 23.

item.title: Bridge attacks will still pose major challenge for DeFi in 2023 — Security experts
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ana Paula Pereira
item.description: Hackers have stolen over $2.5 billion through vulnerabilities on cross-chain bridges in the past two years.

item.title: LastPass attacker stole password vault data, showing Web2's limitations
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: LastPass users with weak master passwords may need to change the individual passwords they stored with the service.

item.title: Web3 projects would rather get hacked than pay bounty: Finance Redefined
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: The top 100 DeFi tokens had a volatile yet bearish week with nearly all the tokens trading in red on the weekly charts.

item.title: Former Alameda CEO confirms firm borrowed billions from FTX customer deposits as part of plea deal
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to court documents, Caroline Ellison said she and SBF signed off on “materially misleading financial statements” for Alameda lenders — knowing it was illegal.

item.title: Crypto Biz: Contagion engulfs Bitcoin miners as bear market continues
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Sam Bourgi
item.description: With the BTC price plunging more than 76% peak-to-trough, miners are struggling to keep their operations running.

item.title: US election agency approves use of NFTs as campaign fundraising incentive
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: According to the FEC, DataVault will receive “reasonable compensation” for each NFT issued to contributors as well as track all tokens issued for its own records.

item.title: Price analysis 12/23: BTC, ETH, BNB, XRP, DOGE, ADA, MATIC, DOT, LTC, UNI
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Rakesh Upadhyay
item.description: Bitcoin and most major altcoins are trading close to their overhead resistance levels, increasing the likelihood of an upward push.

item.title: Play-to-own, NFTs and Web3: Crypto Raiders drops knowledge with NFT Steez
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Alyssa Exposito
item.description: NFT Steez chats with Crypto Raiders about the state of blockchain gaming and how to prioritize fun over “financialization” when it comes to NFTs and P2E models.

item.title: Crypto exchange OKX releases second proof of reserves
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Judith BannermanQuist
item.description: The exchange’s reserves attestation comes only a month after it released its first one and is intended to promote greater transparency in the crypto industry.

item.title: BTC price ignores US PCE data at $16.8K as Bitcoin rejects volatility
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By William Suberg
item.description: The latest U.S. economic data fails to induce volatility in an otherwise flat Bitcoin price playing field.

item.title: SEC general counsel announces departure from public service
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Turner Wright
item.description: “After thirty-four years of public service, it is time for me to pursue new and different challenges and opportunities,” said Dan Berkovitz.

item.title: Top-five most Googled cryptocurrencies worldwide in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Yashu Gola
item.description: Bitcoin remains the most-searched cryptocurrency in 2022 by far thanks to its top-brand status and being in a league of its own when it comes to decentralization.

item.title: OpenSea blocks Cuban artists from the platform due to US sanctions
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Prashant Jha
item.description: OpenSea’s terms of service explicitly prohibit individuals and organizations from sanctioned regions from using its platform.

item.title: What is Wrapped XRP (wXRP), and how does it work?
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Shailey Singh
item.description: Learn what Wrapped XRP is and how to use wXRP on blockchains other than Ripple’s XRP Ledger.

item.title: FTX asks bankruptcy judge to stop BlockFi from claiming Robinhood shares
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: The 56 million Robinhood Markets shares at stake are currently worth around $450 million.

item.title: New NFT private auction scam threatens OpenSea users
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ezra Reguerra
item.description: Phishing sites are making the private auction feature look like a way to log in, luring victims to give up their NFTs unknowingly.

item.title: How crypto could be good for CBDC and vice versa: Industry exec explains
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Helen Partz
item.description: While some governments continue bashing crypto, some industry executives argue that crypto could be beneficial for CBDCs.

item.title: Be ‘very wary’ of crypto proof-of-reserve audits: SEC official
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: SEC’s acting chief accountant Paul Munter said that investors shouldn't place too much confidence in a company holding up a proof-of-reserves audit.

item.title: HK legislator’s firm to lure 1,000 Web3 start-ups over 3 years
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: G-Rocket is aiming to attract 1,000 Web3 start-ups to Hong Kong and will help them with banking, government services and office spaces.

item.title: Crypto Twitter confused by SBF’s $250M bail and a return to luxury
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ciaran Lyons
item.description: The crypto community raised many questions about how FTX’s former CEO was able to secure bail and the conditions it will come with.

item.title: Binance addresses 7 instances of recent FUD via Chinese blog post
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Martin Young
item.description: Binance is fighting back against the tsunami of FUD it has faced in recent weeks.

item.title: BTC miner Core Scientific gets interim nod for $37.4M bankruptcy loan
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Brian Quarmby
item.description: The loan would allow Core Scientific to keep its mining and hosting operations afloat while it restructures.

item.title: The most eco-friendly blockchain networks in 2022
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Elizabeth Gail
item.description: This year saw the realignment of the crypto industry toward greener, more energy-efficient blockchains.

item.title: Rating agencies, not regulators, can rebuild trust in crypto after FTX
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Ben Goertzel
item.description: Private rating agencies could work better and more quickly than regulators when it comes to reviewing businesses in the cryptocurrency industry.

item.title: BNB Chain now has more unique addresses than Ethereum, developer says
item.dc:creator: Cointelegraph By Tom Blackstone
item.description: Despite this growth, BNB Chain still has far less unique addresses than Bitcoin.
